intro: Wyethia angustifolia var. solanensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf wyethia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features include a taproot system and small, glandular hairs on the stems and leaves. It is often found in association with other native wildflowers in its native range.
